result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristie L Benzine

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant Kristie L Benzine in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Kristie L Benzine.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF100 & 21CF128 tracking together:
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1 in 21CF128.  Count 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  22CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Lawton agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 21CF128 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Count 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  22CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Lawton waives the request for a PSI.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1 in 21CF128:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $268.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
*Random UA's as recommended by the Agent
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Credit = 4 days (if revoked)
Cash bond from 22CF100 to be applied to this case

Remainder of Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today 
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Count 2 to be dismissed and read-in. 
22CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.
Credit from 22CF100 will be determined if needed

10:19 AM Defendant Kristie L Benzine appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mark Lawton appears by video.
Court received a motion from Atty Lawton asking the court to grant the motion to withdraw.  Atty Lawton has not been appointed on 22CF100.  
Atty Lawton states that he spoke with his client this morning and she wants to accept the offer on both cases now.  Court questions the defendant.  Atty Juech asks that a plea/sentencing date be set to resolve both cases.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will set both cases for plea/sentencing in person
Jury Trial for Thursday will be taken off the calendar
21CF128 & 22CF100
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kristie L Benzine appeared by video, in custody. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court confirms address. Defendant states that the address is correct for the most part.  Court is unsure what the defendant means.  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 
Defendant is to contact the PD office.

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
